Comment: One of the most uncommon approaches to the opening. Of course, white has the chance to overextend with d5, which offers black a target. But I want to see if the London holds.
One of the most uncommon approaches to the opening. Of course, white has the chance to overextend with d5, which offers black a target. But I want to see if the London holds.
If Nf3 at once, some players play BxN, just to scramble my pawns. I would have an edge, but even so I didn't want to play this line.

I won't force e4... still. I am happy with e3 and c3.
I won't force e4... still. I am happy with e3 and c3.
Wasting time. More important was to catch up in developement, or go c5 at once.
Supporting a future e4.
Still passive, so I can...
...and it's not a loss of tempo, due to the presents black gave to me.
Ok, black makes this hard-to-work-out move, so I have to think carefully about any pawn push. On blitz.

...I just skewered the decision. I'm now planning some attack on the white squares, so I wanted to leave room for my minor pieces, but correct would have been c4, depriving Nf6 from his fly square after e5.
Still passive. Sound, but passive. Black defines white's targets better, while he could have developed instead.
Putting an eye on h7. Now I am threatening e5... but for Nd5 in return. No good plan!
Finally! Black has his chance and takes it. Now, I tried to force something by winning some tempoes while I leave this pawn to make his feeding race.
I planned, after Nd5, something like Bxh6, h4, etc. Probably unsound. Bd3 as second best (NxB, fxN, g5!?).
How to retake? I have three options: dxe5, kicking the N to his dream post, d5, forcing my B do defend. Bxe5, allowing for Ng4 and to have it exchanged or neutralized. So I choosed the "worse" one.

I didn't care at all Bxg2, Rg1, this only helps me. I don't care to exchange the pawn, since then Qxd4 would harm me a lot. I was looking to Nxf7, but I found no trick or mate... still. My problem is Nf6, shielding h7.

This would be a surprise for him, and the exchange option leaves en prise Ra8, so black must be careful.
This was the "munching march" I was allowing him.
Just to make a point of the white squares domination. Probably not the best.
Nxf7 still doesn't work...
